question: The photoelectric work function for photo metal is 2.4 eV. Among the four wavelengths, the wavelength of light for which photo-emission does not take place is
explanation: Threshold wavelength <katex>$\lambda_0 = \frac{hc}{\Phi} \approx \frac{1240 \text{ eV nm}}{2.4 \text{ eV}} \approx 516 \text{ nm}$</katex>.
700 nm is greater than 516 nm, so no emission will take place.
